evidence.source_document: Findings Of Fact And Conclusions Of Law
Findings Of Fact And Conclusions Of Law
evidence.text: State legislators are free to consider a broad array of factors in the design of a legislative district, including partisanship, but they may not use race as a predominant factor and may not use partisanship as a proxy for race. Cooper, 137 S. Ct. at 1473.

evidence.source_document: Findings Of Fact And Conclusions Of Law
evidence.text: In light of the striking evidence that voters were "sort[ed] . . . on the basis of race" within Charleston County and Roberts' in-depth knowledge of the racial demographics of South Carolina, his claim that he did not consider race in drawing Congressional District No. 1 rings "hollow" to the Court. Cooper, 137 S. Ct. at 1477.
